Job Title: Director of Safety

Location: Hickory, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Position Summary:  The Director of Safety will play a pivotal role in ensuring the highest standards of safety, regulatory compliance, and operational excellence within the operations. Duties include defining, developing, implementing programs to ensure compliance and proper engagement with rules and DOT, FMCSA, OSHA, local regulations and company standards, and fostering a culture of safety across the organization. A strong work ethic and attention to the small details will ensure the operations continue to run safely and efficiently. Other duties include communicating with other department managers to coordinate safety activities and the hiring new employees as needed.
FLSA Status: Exempt
Principle Duties and Responsibilities: · Develop and implement safety and compliance programs, policies, and procedures in line with federal, state, and local regulations.· Oversee driver training and orientation programs, emphasizing safety and adherence to industry standards.· Conduct safety audits, inspections, and assessments to identify areas of improvement and ensure compliance.· Investigate and report on accidents, incidents, and violations, providing recommendations for corrective actions.· Manage and maintain compliance records, including driver logs, DOT regulations, and equipment inspections.· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of safety objectives with operational goals.· Stay current with industry regulations and emerging safety trends, implementing best practices as needed.· Lead safety meetings, training sessions, and safety-related communications to enhance awareness and accountability.· Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests, exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.· Follows up on questions or concerns promptly and effectively.· Presents a professional image at all times.· Train and Instruct.· Creates open communication channels with their team. · Performs other duties as assigned by Executive Management Team.  Skills and Specification Requirements: · Excellent customer service skills.· The ability to accept criticism and work well under pressure.· Great leadership skills.· Must have knowledge of transport methods, costs and benefits.· Work well with Drivers.· Able to work in fast-paced multi-functional changing environment.· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.· Attentiveness to detail.· Possession of strong organizational skills.· Excellent conflict resolution skills.· Ability to work independently on assigned tasks as well as to accept direction on given assignments.· Exceptional time management skills.· Able to work flexible hours to complete job tasks.· Able to multi-task and manage priorities.· Must be honest, assertive, and systematic. Education and Experience Required:· AA degree in Transportation or equivalent experience in related field is required.  Physical Requirements:· Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk working on a computer General Information:This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employee(s) will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments.The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills or abilities.This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” relationship.Queen Transportation, LLC is an equal opportunity employer

Experience Level (if available): None
